did.head: Overview
did.unittitle: Howard Ruggles Photographs of Stanford University
did.abstract: These photographs, either taken by Ruggles or acquired by him, are of Stanford sporting events, views of the campus, and the damage to campus buildings by the 1906 earthquake. Earthquake-damaged buildings include Memorial Church, Memorial Arch, the new gymnasium and library, and the entrance gates. General views of the campus include Frenchman's Lake, the Entrance Gates, Palm Drive, and two views of campus taken from the hills behind it, one before and one after the earthquake.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Howard Edwin Ruggles earned his A.B. in physiology at Stanford University in 1907 and his M.D. at Harvard in 1913.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: These photographs, either taken by Ruggles or acquired by him, are of Stanford sporting events, views of the campus, and the damage to campus buildings by the 1906 earthquake. Earthquake-damaged buildings include Memorial Church, Memorial Arch, the new gymnasium and library, and the entrance gates. General views of the campus include Frenchman's Lake, the Entrance Gates, Palm Drive, and two views of campus taken from the hills behind it, one before and one after the earthquake.
